page.text: Hot Ingots are usually produced by heating metal powder in an Electric Blast Furnace. There are some exceptions, such as hot silicon ingots produced by mixing silica powder and carbon powder in an electric blast furnace. Not all ingot materials have the corresponding hot ingot form, but only ingot materials with a smelting temperature greater than 1,750 K have the hot ingot form.
